intro: Melilotus urbanii, commonly known as the yellow melilot, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to parts of Asia. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which is characterized by its legume fruits and nitrogen-fixing abilities. The plant produces small, yellow flowers arranged in spikes, which bloom in early summer. Its leaves are trifoliate, consisting of three oval-shaped leaflets. Melilotus urbanii is often found in grasslands and open woodlands, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
